title.narrative: EHED Socio Economic Empowerment of Marginalized Communities 2016-2018

description.narrative: The Socio Economic Empowerment of Marginalized People is to build the capacity of CBOs to voice community needs, engage in local development and advocate for better service delivery and accountability from duty bearers. Years of conflict damaged the social fabric of the communities and civil society structures in Batticaloa district. Policies and programs do not always address the issues of these most vulnerable members.  Village CBOs are not involved in development decision-making, their awareness of government policies and services is poor,  to access the local authorities, market opportunities and other civil society organizations is limited. The objectives: to increase stable income through diversified livelihoods, to strengthen the existing mechanism for effective micro credit management, to establish and develop mechanisms for well-being of works-force, to build the capacity of civil society structures for sustainable development and to strengthen communities to protect the rights of the war victims for sustainable peace. Expected results: the vulnerable women, members of CBOs will have stable income; engage in the holistic development process where the rights of the marginalized and vulnerable communities are taken into account; members will have greater access to credit mechanism; the informal workforce will be organized and understand their rights; and the community members will be have knowledge in transitional justice process and will be able to engaged in the process. Project wills providing knowledge and awareness, supporting to mobilize and organize right holders by themselves and facilitate to influence policies and advocate for sustainable change. The project will target civil society structures at the district level for collaborative actions a women federation and Migrant Workers Network. The 250 women trained economic empowerment entrepreneurs in 6 villages. Thematic area: Human rights, Social economic and justice and Gender equality.
This project mainly contributes to results within Decent work and fair income. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
